intro: Thymus borbasii, commonly known as Borbas's thyme, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of the Mediterranean. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, releasing a strong, pungent scent when crushed. Thymus borbasii is often used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb, similar to other thyme species.
